item.title: Sailing minigame
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:8, topic:552277”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=671195.msg4488611#msg4488611 date=1435893333]
The only other big problem i have right now is that the tiles show over the player when i have them change appearance to the ship im using the pnpc method i know in the client you can adjust abyte68 in entity defintions and it will adjust how many tiles the model covers but if yoj do pnpc it doeant adjust it for the player as well do you have any idea how i ca make this work?
[/quote]

just do the same thing but for the player instead of npc[/quote]

Do you know what id need to change all i know of is the abyte68 on the client side for npc’s

Read full topic

item.title: Sailing minigame
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

It would send the opponent to the right region and the requesting player would stay in the same region but the opponents model would populate in the right spot compared to the requesting players position but the region just would not update. I think it may be a client issue as in having two clients open locally not sure. But how i resolved it is just sending the requesting player to a different region and then to the correct one using a timer so i can shorten time just kept it a little higher so that it had time but ill adjust it.

The only other big problem i have right now is that the tiles show over the player when i have them change appearance to the ship im using the pnpc method i know in the client you can adjust abyte68 in entity defintions and it will adjust how many tiles the model covers but if yoj do pnpc it doeant adjust it for the player as well do you have any idea how i ca make this work?

Pure_:

If you make a recording of this which doesn’t suck dick I’ll put it in the next weekly news.

Awesome! Will do:D

Read full topic

item.title: Sailing minigame
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:3, topic:552277”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671195.msg4488598#msg4488598 date=1435890745]
Screen recorder would have been much better.
I can hardly tell what’s going on with your shaky camera holding…

Why don’t both players load around the same time? The one loaded into the water in like 5 seconds while the other took like 20… If the second player registers for the first, but himself is not registered, then the first one has an advantage.

This also reminds me of part of a quest on runescape (I forget which) where you have to operate a small ship and take out 3 enemies before your boat dies.

If you can fix that loading issue, this would be much better.
You should also implement better controls… because you don’t want the text to show in the chatbox from the user inputting their movements.
[/quote]

Thanks for the time and criticism, yea definitely its just a prototype lol still have stuff to do but yea as far as the loading i can.make it go a little quicker just was having some technical issues with the moveplayer method, it would changeregions for some reason so had to send the player to a different region by himself then send him next to the other player. It is a really weird complication i was having[/quote]
That does sound weird indeed.
So it wouldn’t just directly move them to the area?
You could try making them go into a ‘lobby’ (Both/all players) area first, and then into the game area to see if it’d sync up correctly.

Read full topic

If you can fix that loading issue, this would be much better.

It is a really weird complication i was having

Screen recorder would have been much better.

Why don’t both players load around the same time? The one loaded into the water in like 5 seconds while the other took like 20… If the second player registers for the first, but himself is not registered, then the first one has an advantage.
